key_facts: LinkedIn is a professional networking platform connecting individuals, companies, and recruiters globally.
LinkedIn offers job seekers opportunities to build networks and find career-related opportunities.
Companies use LinkedIn for employer branding and posting job openings.
Advertisers can target users based on professional roles, industries, and interests.
LinkedIn's primary channels are its mobile app and website.
Key resources include the technology platform, user data, and brand reputation.
LinkedIn partners with content creators known as 'Top Voices' to promote content.
LinkedIn collaborates with educational institutions to offer certification-based learning content.
Premium subscriptions provide features like InMail credits and advanced job search tools.
Advertising revenue comes from companies paying to promote products or services.
Platform development, marketing, sales, and customer support are major cost areas.
LinkedIn serves three main customer segments: professionals, companies/recruiters, and advertisers.
Enterprise customers receive direct support, while most users rely on self-service.
The platform enables professionals to connect with industry leaders and improve skills.
LinkedIn uses data to match job seekers with relevant opportunities.
